greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary representation of prime power divisors of n: sum(p^k | n, 2^(A065515(p^k)-1)).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The prime power divisors of 12 are 2, 3, and 4. These are indices 1, 2, and 3 in the list of prime powers, so a(12) = 2^(1-1) + 2^(2-1) + 2^(3-1) = 7.
program: a248906 = sum . map ((2 ^) . subtract 2 . a095874) . tail . a210208_row
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 06 2015
